intro: Sphaeralcea fendleri subsp. albescens, commonly known as the white globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and its role in supporting local pollinators.
